    • Field Detail

      • functions

        public static java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.function.BiFunction<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String,​java.lang.String>> functions
        List of functions which are executed as part of the translation functions. When the placeholder parser begins parsing a string, it will parse the following format as below: {VARIABLE|function:"HH:MM:SS"} Where `VARIABLE` would be the name of the variables passed to the TranslateVariables function, `function` would be the name of the function in this class to execute, and everything in quotes after the colon would be the 2nd argument passed to the functions in this map. Each function takes 2 arguments, the first being the dereferenced value of the variable itself as a string and the 2nd being the additional arguments provided in quotes after the colon in the placeholder string. For example a string with `{TimeBanned|datetime:"HH:MM:SS"}` would execute the `datetime` function in the map below as: datetime(Variables.get("TimeBanned"), "HH:MM:SS")

      • SPECIAL_CHAR

        public static final char SPECIAL_CHAR
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • isxdigit

        @Deprecated
public static boolean isxdigit​(char ch)
        Deprecated.
        Since Minecraft 1.16 supports 32 bit colors, this function will be deprecated.
        Checks if the character is a valid minecraft color code

        Returns true if the character is valid minecraft colorcode

        Parameters:
        ch - The character to check for a valid color code char
        Returns:
        Boolean

      • translateColors

        public static java.lang.String translateColors​(java.lang.String chars,
                                               java.lang.String message)
        Replace the character sequence in `chars` to swap out with the minecraft color char while also validating that the color code sequence is valid.

        Returns a color formatted message for Minecraft clients

        Parameters:
        chars - Character sequence to replace with the section character minecraft uses for color codes
        message - Message containing sequences of `chars` in it
        Returns:
        String.

      • translateVariables

        public static java.lang.String translateVariables​(LocaleProvider locale,
                                                  java.lang.String message,
                                                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> Variables)
        Replace all placeholders in a string, executing placeholder functions in the process to format strings with variables provided.

        Returns a formatted string with all placeholders from Variables replaced.

        Parameters:
        locale - The LocaleProvider context
        message - The message to have placeholders replaced
        Variables - The variables to be utilized in this message for the placeholders and their functions
        Returns:
        String

      • translate

        public static java.lang.String translate​(LocaleProvider locale,
                                         java.lang.String message,
                                         java.lang.String ColorChars,
                                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> Variables)
        Translate the preformatted string to a fully formatted string ready for players to see, switching out color codes and placeholders.

        Returns a string with color sequences and placeholders translated to their formatted message ready for the player.

        Parameters:
        locale - The LocaleProvider context
        message - The message containing placeholders and untranslated color code sequences
        ColorChars - The character used as the prefix for color strings (bukkit/spigot use `&` and so do we most of the time)
        Variables - A list of variables to be parsed by the placeholder
        Returns:
        String
